text: Shahzada Mirza Sultan Muhammad Suhrab Hindi Bahadur (1820 – c. 1889) also known as Mirza Mendhu Sahib was a son of Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah II and Moti Bai. Ahter the Indian Mutiny 1857-1858, he became a dervish (Sufi aspirant) in Udaipur where the Maharana of Mewar granted him a small subsistence pension. ==References== Category:1820 births Category:1889 deaths Category:Mughal princes
title: Mirza Suhrab Hindi
